meanings.definition: In a manner using many syllables.
meanings.sent1: She spoke polysyllabically, making it hard to understand.
meanings.sent2: The teacher explained the concept polysyllabically to the students.
meanings.sent3: The parrot tried to repeat the word polysyllabically, but got it all wrong.
meanings.sent4: The music flowed polysyllabically, filling the room with complex sounds.
meanings.sent5: The child practiced saying the tongue twister polysyllabically until he got it right.

meanings.sent1: The polysyllabically word confused the young readers.
meanings.sent2: The ancient language had many polysyllabically words.
meanings.sent3: The cat's name was so polysyllabically that no one could remember it.
meanings.sent4: The forest was filled with the polysyllabically names of exotic plants.
meanings.sent5: The professor's polysyllabically lecture left the students feeling overwhelmed.
